front.title: Performance Measurement for Segment Routing Networks with MPLS Data Plane

abstract.t: RFC 6374 specifies protocol mechanisms to enable the efficient and accurate measurement of packet loss, one-way and two-way delay, as well as related metrics such as delay variation in MPLS networks using synthetic probe messages. This document reviews how these mechanisms can be used for Performance Delay and Loss Measurements in Segment Routing (SR) networks with MPLS data plane (SR-MPLS), for both SR links and end-to-end SR Policies. The Performance Measurements (PM) for SR links are used to compute extended Traffic Engineering (TE) metrics for delay and loss and can be advertised in the network using the routing protocol extensions.
